projectPurpose: To provide a comprehensive graphical user interface (GUI) for configuring and monitoring various aspects of graphics processing units (GPUs) from different vendors (AMD, Nvidia, Intel) on Linux systems.
mainFeatures: Power and thermals monitoring and configuration

alternatives.name: AMD Radeon Software for Linux
mainFeatures: Provides official drivers for AMD GPUs
May include limited GUI components depending on distribution and version

alternatives.name: CoreCtrl
mainFeatures: GPU and CPU monitoring and configuration

alternatives.name: nvtop
mainFeatures: htop-like terminal interface for GPU monitoring
Supports multiple GPU vendors (AMD, Intel, NVIDIA, etc.)
Displays process list using the GPU
Shows temperatures, fan speed, power usage, clock speeds

alternatives.name: nvidia-smi
mainFeatures: Lists processes running on the GPU

alternatives.name: intel_gpu_top
mainFeatures: Command-line tool for monitoring Intel GPU usage

alternatives.name: RadeonTop
mainFeatures: Command-line tool for monitoring AMD GPU usage
Works with the open-source Mesa driver

marketPositioning: LACT positions itself as a comprehensive, vendor-agnostic GUI tool for advanced GPU configuration and monitoring on Linux. While vendor-specific tools exist (NVIDIA, AMD) and offer proprietary features, and other open-source tools focus primarily on monitoring (nvtop, intel_gpu_top, RadeonTop) or include CPU controls (CoreCtrl), LACT differentiates itself by providing a unified graphical interface with extensive control options (overclocking, fan curves, power states) across AMD, Nvidia, and Intel GPUs. It aims to fill the gap for Linux users seeking a single, powerful GUI application for managing their graphics card's performance and thermals, comparable to the control offered by proprietary software on other operating systems.
